result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Noah B Kuehn

records.addlTxt:
8:44 AM; Case called for Hearing. Prosecuting attorney Christian Farina in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Noah B Kuehn in court.  Attorney Brandon K. Carlson in court for Noah B Kuehn.  Atty. Carlson provides an update; he recently received discovery, he is waiting on an offer, and needs time to review discovery.  Atty. Carlson requests a further proceedings date in about 45-60 days.  No objection by the State.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.
Hearing scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.
ERROR - DUPLICATE PLEASE IGNORE: Pre-trial conference on September 16, 2022 at 09:30 am.
ERROR - DUPLICATE PLEASE IGNORE: Pre-trial conference on September 16, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance letter dated 7/22/22 received and filed.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.    Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 3 supervision.  The defendant is ordered to comply with drug testing through WCS.  Drug testing frequency pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with drug testing.  The Defendant to report to WCS within 1 business day of being released.

02:22 PM Defendant Noah B Kuehn in court, in custody, with State Public Defender Law Intern.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 09:30 am.

***DEFENDANT REQUESTS TO CHANGE THE ADDRESS BACK TO WHAT WAS ON THE CRIMINAL COMPLIANT.**
